SHORT_DESCR.P: Lillehammer municipality shall lay a new main pipeline installations along the beach zone by Mjøsa between PK2 and PK3 in order to increase security. The pipeline installations consist of an approx. 1.3 km pipeline ditch. Parts of this must be founded on friction piles. The new pipeline installations are to be established in a parallel line to the existing pipeline installations.
— Water pipeline Ø600mm, ductile cast iron, length approx. 830 m,
— Water pipeline Ø200mm, PVC, length approx. 70 m,
— Water pipeline Ø150mm, ductile cast iron, length approx. 260 m,
— Joint sewage pipeline Ø800mm, concrete, length approx. 530 m,
— Joint sewage pipeline Ø600mm, concrete, length approx. 260 m,
— Joint sewage pipeline Ø400mm, concrete, length approx. 270 m,
— Surface water pipeline Ø600/500/300mm, concrete, length approx. 160 m,
— 4 intake and outlet manholes for pump stations, cast on site,
The length of the contract work, see point II.2.7, has not yet been finally decided, the length is subject to change in the final notice.

SUITABILITY.P: — The company shall be legally registered.
The company´s tax affairs shall be in order in relation to payment of tax and charges.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The company must have a credit rating that at least is equivalent to good creditworthiness, and otherwise have sufficient finances to carry out the assignment.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The company must have satisfactory technical and professional qualifications from equivalent types of assignments.
— Central certification for the relevant work in development class 3 or equivalent competence,

RULES_CRITERIA.P: — Tenderers must have sufficient capacity to carry out the work,
— Sub-contractors must fulfil relevant requirements that are equivalent to the requirements set for the main contractor,
— Person(s) with daily administrative responsibilities and execution responsibilities for the contract must be employed at the main contractor.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Tenderers must fulfil the requirements in NS8406 as well as Lillehammer municipality´s special contract terms.
